intro: Swainsona formosa, commonly known as the yellow trumpet bush, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant is characterized by its bright yellow, trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are compound, consisting of several oval-shaped leaflets, and it produces long, slender pods that contain seeds. Swainsona formosa is adapted to withstand drought and is often found in rocky soils and along dry streambeds.
